server_costs.title: Server Costs
server_costs.description: Hi, viddie here. Unsurprisingly, running servers costs money, and while I can pour in as much time as I like into creating this project, someone has to pay to keep the server running. This website does not (and will never) have ADs. I am willing to pay for the server costs all by myself if necessary, but if anyone in the community wants to help me out, I would gladly appreciate it!

costs_so_far.title: Costs So Far
costs_so_far.description: The server has been running since April, 2024. That's {{months}} months so far.
costs_so_far.not_lose: This is the amount of € that I need to not lose money

stocked_up.title: Stocked Up
stocked_up.description: The server can run for {{months}} more months on just donations!

you_can_help.title: You Can Help
you_can_help.description: If you want to help keep the server running, you can donate using the following methods:

table.note: * Donations do not update automatically, it might take a bit for your donation to show up.

thank_you.title: Thank You
thank_you.description: If you donate and want to be mentioned on this page, leave a name in your donation message!

post_donation.text: I appreciate it! Do note that donations aren't automatically put on the list of Contributors, so it might take a while for your donation to be added!

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: This page exists mostly as a formalization of rules and edge cases for said rules. The most basic form of required submission rules is "don't cheat, don't use gameplay-altering mods, have a full session recording for Tier 8+ challenges, and make sure to show the end screen". However, this formalization exists to cover potential confusion for certain edge cases and all the like. This list isn't exhaustive. It can't be. Mappers come up with ways to subvert our expectations all the time, and if we tried to formalize the minefield that it is, we would get nowhere. If you have an edge case not covered by this list, or general questions about it, please ask us! Ask us before you make a submission that results in days of debate that may or may not result in it getting rejected. Thank you.

entries.heading: Available
entries.text: The map or map pack must be uploaded to GameBanana. If a map was previously on GameBanana but taken down afterwards, it will be uploaded to this archive.org item unless the map creator specifically requests to remove its downloadability.

entries.heading: Non-Trivial
entries.text: The map or map pack must contain a challenge that poses a non-trivial amount of danger, even if that danger may be small. Maps where all challenges contain little to no danger will be rejected. An example of a map that, while difficult, does not meet the danger requirement is Ultra Skrimbles. In rare circumstances, usually when a map is part of a more complete campaign or lobby, exceptions will be made, such as for Summit Down-Side Silver. Maps with this property will be labeled as "Untiered".

entries.heading: Non-Duplicate
entries.text: The map or map pack is recommended to not resemble a base game map or an existing custom map to a high degree. For some examples, unique map packs such as Etselec or more thoughtful, usually more difficult edits such as Farewell^9 are acceptable, while maps such as 1a Undefined are likely to be rejected.

entries.heading: Non-NSFW
entries.text: The map or map pack must not contain adult or offensive content. This includes, but is not limited to, nudity, pornography, gore, extreme fetish material, or offensive statements or depictions of a protected minority.

entries.heading: Self-Contained
entries.text: Challenges in a map pack must not involve activities performed outside of Celeste. An example of such a case is The Golden Challenge.

entries.heading: Permanent Video Source
entries.text: The submission video must be uploaded to a permanent place that does not require an account to view. The most popular sites for such videos are YouTube, Twitch, bilibili, and nicovideo, but sites outside of these are perfectly fine to be submitted. A messaging service CDN (i.e. cdn.discordapp.com or similar) is not accepted for submissions. A link that is able to expire by virtue of time only (i.e. 0x0.st links) is not accepted for submissions.

entries.heading: Complete Footage
entries.text: The submission video must show the complete achievement of the challenge, e.g. from obtaining the golden strawberry to when the golden strawberry collects. It is not necessary that one must stay alive after the completion of the challenge but before exiting the map (e.g. "Heart Deaths", an example of which can be found in the golden of Magnetic Dawn B-Side). Note that a golden strawberry collecting may not always be the end of a challenge, such as a berry remaining in a full clear challenge, as is the case for Heather's Aquarium Full Clear. Exceptions to this are very rare and evaluated on a case-by-case basis, such as a livestream cutting out for a brief moment, so long as the circumstances and player are deemed trustworthy.

entries.heading: End Screen
entries.text: Submissions must show the end screen of a map upon completing the challenge. If an end screen does not exist, the journal must be shown immediately after exiting. IMPORTANT: For collab maps you have to enable the mod option Collab Utils 2 → Display End Screen For All Maps AND enable the speedrun timer for the end screen to show up. If you don't like the timer being always visible, SpeedrunTool has an option to automatically show the timer only for the end screen at Speedrun Tool → More Options → Enable Timer on Area Complete.

entries.heading: Session
entries.text: Submissions must be done in one continuous play session.

entries.heading: Unchanged Gameplay
entries.text: Submissions must not make use of gameplay-altering mods, variants, or assist mode outside what is allowed by the map. This includes the No Freeze Frames variant in Extended Variants. Visual-altering mods and variants may be allowed on a case-by-case basis. See allowed and recommended mods for more details.

entries.heading: Raw Footage
entries.text: Submissions for challenges as or more difficult than Tier 8 must have a recording of a full session. In the event that the submission was done near the beginning of the session, a request for a previous session recording may be asked.

entries.heading: Info Mods
entries.text: Submissions must not make use of "info mods" which give you information that you otherwise would not know during gameplay, such as input history, stamina bar, or CelesteTAS's info HUD. On challenges where these make little to no difference, submissions will be given warning notes and eventually rejected. On challenges or submissions where these make a difference, such as subpixel-level alignment, stamina-heavy challenges, or gauging information to perform a strat or save, submissions will be rejected without a warning.

entries.heading: Pause Abuse
entries.text: Submissions must not abuse the pause button in such a way that makes gameplay easier. One extreme example of pause abuse that would be grounds for rejection is pause buffering, wherein the pause button is "buffered" between pauses to advance the game frame-by-frame. Making inputs easier by pausing is always banned, even if you are not advancing frame-by-frame. If there is no danger of death, however, pausing may be used to perform otherwise difficult or repetitive setups. Also, pausing may be used sparingly during gameplay in an unexpected scenario to give the player time to think. Even in such a scenario, it is not allowed to pause multiple times to line up an otherwise difficult input. Note that similarly to the No Freeze Frames Extended Variant, a small number of legacy submissions that violate this rule exist that would otherwise be rejected. Pause abuse is not to be confused with pause tech, which are tech that require the pause button to work in specific gameplay circumstances. Pause tech is always allowed for use. This includes pausing for slowfall in a position where a jump would be input otherwise, pausing during bino control storage, and spinner stunning, as referenced in rule #9.

entries.heading: Spinner Freeze/Stun
entries.text: Submissions must not abuse spinner freezing, where the player waits ~118 hours ingame to prevent certain spinners from loading. Submissions may utilize the technique known as spinner stunning due to its extreme frame-perfect nature and general unviability for goldens. For more info on these techniques, check out the video on them by EuniverseCat.

entries.heading: No Golden Berry
entries.text: Challenges with the Deathless objective do not have a deathless berry placed in the map, but must still be completed deathless. For maps with this objective, one is allowed to use the console command give_golden to give themselves a golden strawberry. This command must be used in the first room of the map at a place trivially accessible from chapter restart. Alternatively, one may use Ahorn or Lönn to add a golden strawberry in the first room of the map at a place trivially accessible from chapter restart. However, one is not allowed to use a manually placed golden strawberry to their advantage. This includes dying during an ending heart collect, as well as using the light emitted by the golden for visibility in a map such as view.

entries.heading: Deathless Berryless
entries.text: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, the submission does not have to actually collect the berry so long as the run follows the same challenge requirements (A.K.A. a deathless berryless run). Runs where a golden strawberry is fundamentally different than a non-golden, such as a golden room, will most likely not be accepted in this manner. In addition, the golden strawberry must be collected in any map with golden changes, such as detaches, that cause the berry to be lost. While deathless berryless is of course discouraged and we urge submissions to collect the applicable berry, we also understand that sometimes things happen and people unexpectedly fluke, and we don't want that to take away from anyone's achievement. Deathless berryless submissions will be given a note.

entries.heading: No Golden Collect Trigger
entries.text: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, submissions may edit the end of a map to add a golden collect trigger if and only if a golden collect trigger does not exist. If a crystal heart indicates the ending but doesn't kick the player out, editing it to kick the player out is fine. This will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, as this is very rare.

entries.heading: Intended Golden Detach
entries.text: For golden strawberry (or other similar berry) submissions, submissions are allowed to die during map intentional golden strawberry detachments as many times as one would like. This does not apply to golden detachments made to fix an issue (such as in A Beautiful Meadow) or unintentional golden detachments.

entries.heading: Progression
entries.text: Submissions must follow the bounds of progression existing within the challenge. If a challenge involves global flags or other things existing outside the scope of the challenge, it can be assumed that they are unlocked. If it is significant enough, challenges may be separated based on these flags.

entries.heading: Overlay
entries.text: Submissions must not have an overlay covering a large amount or essential parts of the screen. Essential parts include the timer, the total berry count in the top left, the pause menu berry tracker, the player, and the save icon in the bottom right.

full_game_additional.header: Additional Rules for Full Game Submissions
full_game_additional.explanation: There are two types of "full game" submissions: ones that complete a relevant subset of all maps in a map pack (which will be referred to as partial full game runs), such as all c-sides deathless or beginner lobby deathless, and complete full game runs, such as all maps deathless or 100% deathless. Rules which apply to only a specific category of these will be indicated.

entries.heading: Complete Footage
entries.text: The submission video must show the run in full. For a partial full game run, the video must start at or before the chapter select screen of the first map completed and end after completing the final map. For a complete full game run, the video must start at or before the file select screen and end after completing the final map.

entries.heading: Progression
entries.text: As a reminder, or if one is only looking at this section of the rules, rule #14 in the list for all submissions explains how one should treat progression for challenges, which includes full game challenges. In general, full game submissions must start from what is effectively a new save file, while partial full game submissions can vary. For an example, consider the vanilla game. If one were to do all A-Sides deathless, they must be done in order, as 1a unlocks 2a, 2a unlocks 3a, etc. If one were to do all B-Sides deathless, they can be done in any order, as unlocking them is irrespective of progression within the B-Sides themselves. If one were to do 100% deathless, it must be done from a new file.

entries.heading: No Return to Map
entries.text: Submissions must not use "Return to Map" or any similar option to reset the state of a room. The state of a room includes, but is not limited to: player position, one-time dash crystals, falling blocks, kevin positions, switches, etc.

entries.heading: Single Save File
entries.text: Submissions must not utilize more than one save file in any form.

entries.heading: Forced Deaths
entries.text: If the run has forced deaths (e.g. a Farewell-esque moon berry), runs are allowed to die in such instances, but no more than the minimum required to pass the section. Do note that this is different than if one was doing the map alone deathless, as described in rule #13.

entries.heading: File Timer
entries.text: Submissions must have the "File Timer" enabled, not just the chapter timer.

entries.heading: Long Breaks
entries.text: Submissions are recommended to not take long or frequent breaks on the menu or pause screen. It is more acceptable to take breaks while inside a map and not paused, though taking frequent breaks might raise suspicion and request for more proof.

entries.heading: Submittable Deathless-Berryless
entries.text: If a submission does not collect golden/silver berries, it may be submitted for individual map runs on the respective sheet if the challenge follows the same aforementioned rule about deathless berryless runs.

section.explanation: These aren't exactly rules that need to be followed, but they help in aiding proof strength, avoiding giving your submission a note, helping one complete a challenge, or is a general courteous decision for others.

entries.text: Using the chapter or file timer will help credibility, but it is not required for single-map submissions. Recall that file timer is required for full game submissions.

Using an external input display, such as <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/ThoNohT/NohBoard">NohBoard</CustomExternalLink> for Windows, <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/yoshiyoshyosh/kbdisplay">kbdisplay</CustomExternalLink> for Linux (X11), or <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/RoanH/KeysPerSecond">KeysPerSecond</CustomExternalLink> for cross-platform, will help credibility. Individuals using a controller may also use input displays such as <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamepadviewer.com">GamePad Viewer</CustomExternalLink> or <CustomExternalLink href="https://www.ballini.uk/openjoystick.htm">Joystick Display</CustomExternalLink>. One may also use the <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/34273">Input History</CustomExternalLink> mod as an input display provided that the settings for showing frame counts and input history are disabled.
Keep a few full session runs on hand, especially for high tier goldens, in the event that a verifier requests more proof than what is required.

section.explanation: All mods listed here are allowed for submissions unless otherwise specified. Mods not listed here are also allowed for submissions unless they violate the gameplay altering mod rule or info gaining mod rule.

entries.text: The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/421816">Deadzone Config</CustomExternalLink> and <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/tools/13384">viddie's Toolbox</CustomExternalLink> mods allow individuals using a controller to configure their deadzone, most notably to make fastfalling and other awkward diagonal inputs easier.

For complete full game runs, using the Hardcore Mode mod may help reset runs faster, but is not required. Hardcore mode will also allow goldens to spawn without needing cheat mode, which means the full game run may be submitted to individual maps without issue. The Collab Platinums mod is another quality of life option for full game runs, allowing players to place a platinum berry in a collab lobby for faster resetting when doing full game runs from an existing file. The mod also adds an extension to the journal, which only shows stats from the current run. Full game runs that are done from an existing file with a platinum berry must show the platinum journal at the end of the run. Please note that picking up a deathless berry when it would not normally be unlocked from a new file can be grounds for rejection in the rare case of the map having golden changes which make the deathless run easier.

The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/363600">Golden QOL</CustomExternalLink> mod is allowed for submissions. This mod gives players some helpful quality of life features, such as making the golden berry transparent, being able to place a persistent golden berry without using a map editor, or allowing one to start at the same room they died in a golden run. The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/tools/6924">Strawberry Tool</CustomExternalLink> mod is another option for making followers transparent, and is also allowed for submissions.

The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/tools/6597">Speedrun Tool</CustomExternalLink> mod and <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/tools/6715">CelesteTAS</CustomExternalLink> mods can help finding strategies and setups for parts in a challenge. Do note, however, that utilizing any gameplay-altering of info-gaining features of these mods during a challenge is disallowed.

The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/514173">Motion Smoothing</CustomExternalLink> mod allows players to raise the FPS above 60 without breaking physics. This mod is allowed for submissions, but any other mods which are capable of raising the FPS above 60 are disallowed if they break physics.

The <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/464283">izumi’s quality of life</CustomExternalLink> mod adds many general quality of life features, such as being able to take snapshots of the journal and compare them with current stats, showing stats for all the sides of a chapter separately, having a warning icon appear when you’re not recording, and having hotkeys to swap between configurations of keybinds. The mod is allowed for submissions, but utilizing any gameplay-altering or info-gaining features of the mod during a challenge is disallowed. Changing your controls during a challenge is only allowed when you are not in danger of death. For example, changing your controls when you are grounded or grabbing a wall is allowed in most cases, but changing your controls while you are airborne and/or performing a sequence of inputs may be grounds for rejection.

Other mods frequently used for deathless challenges include <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/358978">Consistency Tracker</CustomExternalLink> and <CustomExternalLink href="https://gamebanana.com/mods/53681">DeathTracker</CustomExternalLink>.

entries.question: Can I submit maps that aren't in the list yet?
entries.answer: Yes, you can submit a golden for a map that isn't in the list yet. In this case you must also provide a link to the map and make sure that the map follows all the rules. But even if it does, we may not add it to the list for certain reasons which we will specify in the page with rejected maps.

entries.question: Are demodash buttons/multiple jump binds allowed?
entries.answer: Demodash buttons and multiple jump binds are allowed. The same goes for any combination of inputs that can be mapped on the same key/button, but external macros which press multiple inputs on different frames are not allowed.

entries.question: What is the criteria for getting a full clear?
entries.answer: Because of how different maps can be, this has the potential to vary wildly. The most basic form of a full clear is obtaining all collectibles that do not represent a different challenge than the one being performed. For example, consider a map that has red berries, a cassette, a crystal heart, and a dashless golden berry. If one were to perform a full clear of the map, they would be required to collect the red berries, the cassette, and the crystal heart. The dashless golden berry represents a different challenge--doing the map dashless--and thus is not needed for a full clear. If it is impossible to get all the collectibles dashless, the dashless challenge would not contain a full clear flag. If it is possible, both the normal challenge and the dashless challenge will have full clear flags.

entries.question: Why are some maps ineligible for full clear runs?
entries.answer: Some maps have collectibles which are not optional, such as the strawberries in Hell Gym.

entries.question: This map is way harder than what it says on the list! What gives?
entries.answer: A challenge is ranked by the easiest strategies possible to complete it. If a map contains major cheese, the route with the major cheese will be what is used to rank the map. Additionally, again, rankings are subjective and based on those who have completed the challenge. One can suggest a difficulty change for any challenge if they so wish.

entries.question: What is the Untiered difficulty for?
entries.answer: The Untiered difficulty is reserved for challenges that are trivial to complete compared to a clear. These include one-room maps where a normal clear is the exact same as the golden as well as campaign maps where it is impossible to die.

entries.question: Are co-op maps allowed? Are maps involving X allowed?
entries.answer: If a map follows all the rules established for map rules, it is allowed. In the case of co-op maps, the difficulty will be gauged based on the intended player count of the map.

vanilla_references.question: Why are vanilla challenges not on this list?
vanilla_references.answer:
Vanilla challenges are not tracked due to them being outside the scope of a modded list, as well as having too many clears to reasonably track. However, many of their difficulties are commonly agreed upon. Below is a reference list of where vanilla challenges would roughly place on the Top Golden List.

Note: In the past, Farewell [No DTS] was considered the baseline for Tier 8 on the Top Golden List. This is no longer the case, and the golden is now simply within the tier. Additionally, the hell trio goldens (6B, 7B, 8B) no longer represent a strict baseline for Tier 4.

welcome.text: The main goal of this website is to maintain all the deathless clears of maps or campaigns, as well as motivating people to go for deathless challenges and making the deathless completion scene of Celeste more active in general. The website shows all the maps that have been completed without dying, as well as names of people who did the goldens.
welcome.info: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to join the Modded Golden Team Discord server and ask there, or contact any of the team members directly.

links.survivors_list: Celeste Survivors List (Deathless runs of vanilla Celeste)

issues.text: If you find any issues, please report them by either creating a <CustomExternalLink href="https://github.com/yoshiyoshyosh/goldberries/issues">new issue on GitHub</CustomExternalLink> or by @-ing viddie in the Modded Golden Team Discord server, preferably in the <CustomExternalLink href="https://discord.com/channels/790156040653897749/1269306272776458321">dedicated channel</CustomExternalLink> for this website.

totals.campaigns: {{campaigns}} campaigns ({{standalone}} of them are stand-alone maps)

difficulty_stats.text: Number of submissions in each tier

getting_started.preface: To make a submission to this website, you need to do the following:
getting_started.video: Have video proof of your deathless run, uploaded to a permanent place (e.g. YouTube, bilibili, ...)
getting_started.account: Register an account and login to your account. You can sign-up via Discord or email address & password
getting_started.player: Claim a player. If you already had submissions on the spreadsheet your "player" will already exist, and you need to claim it for yourself. If this is your first submission, you can create a new player for yourself.
getting_started.submit: Read the <RulesLink>rules</RulesLink>, head over to <CustomLink>the submit page</CustomLink> and make your submission!

newly_released.text: This website has just recently been released! Given the chaotic state of data on the spreadsheet, it's to be expected that there will be wrong or inconsistent data somewhere. When you spot some, please report it in the Modded Golden Team Discord server!
newly_released.migration: Migrating all of the data, as well as the entire community over to this website will take a while, so for the time being you can still make your submissions the old-fashioned way, by tagging the modded golden team in the Celeste Discord server, or the Modded Golden Team Discord server.

rework.text: As of February 2025, the tier rework has launched! These changes were made for many reasons, including making high tier changes easier in the future, facilitating a better process for adding new highest tiers, and normalizing the tiers into a simple ascending number system.
bullet_points: Tier names are now changed to start at Tier 1 for the easiest difficulty and ascend as difficulty increases.

The "Standard" difficulty is now represented by the 3 lowest tiers. These tiers are hidden by default on the Top Golden List due to increased load times, but they can be shown by adjusting the "Minimum Tier" in submission filters.
Every subtier is now represented by its own tier.
A new tier has been added between the old High Tier 1 and Low Tier 0, bringing the total number of tiers to 20.
rework.more_text: An option has been added to stack the highest tiers vertically (disabled by default) to make the Top Golden List more compact, like it was before the rework.
